parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From paraballo; a similitude, i.e. fictitious narrative, apothegm or adage.
No one, none, nothing.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To rend, divide asunder, cleave. Apparently a primary verb; to split or sever.
A patch on a garment. From epiballo; a patch.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Old, ancient, not new or recent. From palai; antique, i.e. Not recent, worn out.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To agree with, harmonize with, agree together. From sumphonos; to be harmonious, i.e. to accord or stipulate.
